alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Grayson; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 11:18PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Alleghany, Surry, Wilkes and northwestern Yadkin Counties in northwestern North Carolina, Carroll, southeastern Grayson and southwestern Patrick Counties in southwestern Virginia and the City of Galax through 1145 PM EDT... At 1118 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Fries to Roaring Gap to Wilkesboro Reservoir. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Airy... Galax... North Wilkesboro... Elkin... Wilkesboro... Fairview... and Flat Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
